required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Artificial Intelligence for Detecting Retinal Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Classification of Retinal Diseases by Artificial Intelligence

collaborator.agency: Beijing Tulip Partner Technology Co., Ltd, China

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to apply an artificial intelligence algorithm to diagnose multi retinal diseases from fundus photography. The effectiveness and accuracy of this algorithm was evaluated by sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, and area under curve.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is to apply an artificial intelligence algorithm to diagnose referral diabetes retinopathy, referral age-related macular degeneration, referral possible glaucoma, pathological myopia, retinal vein occlusion, macular hole, macular epiretinal membrane, hypertensive retinopathy, myelinated fibers, retinitis pigmentosa and other retinal lesions from fundus photography. The effectiveness and accuracy of this algorithm was evaluated by sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, area under curve, and F1 score.

primary_outcome.description: We used the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve and area under curve to examine the ability of this artificial intelligence algorism recognition and classification of retinal diseases.
We used sensitivity and specificity to examine the ability of this artificial intelligence algorism recognition and classification of retinal diseases.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive predictive value, negative predictive value
primary_outcome.description: We used positive predictive value and negative predictive value to examine the ability of this artificial intelligence algorism recognition and classification of retinal diseases.
We used F1 score to examine the ability of this artificial intelligence algorism recognition and classification of retinal diseases.

secondary_outcome.description: Using medical records as the gold standard, we test the accuracy of this artificial intelligence algorism recognition and classification of systemic biomarkers and diseases: age, sex, blood pressure, blood hemoglobin, cardiovascular diseases, thyroid function and kidney function.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Retinal diseases diagnosed by artificial intelligence algorithm
arm_group.description: Retinal diseases diagnosed by artificial intelligence algorithm

intervention.intervention_name: Retinal diseases diagnosed by artificial intelligence algorithm
intervention.description: An artificial intelligence algorithm was applied to diagnose referral diabetes retinopathy, referral age-related macular degeneration, referral possible glaucoma, pathological myopia, retinal vein occlusion, macular hole, macular epiretinal membrane, hypertensive retinopathy, myelinated fibers, retinitis pigmentosa and other retinal lesions from fundus photography.
intervention.arm_group_label: Retinal diseases diagnosed by artificial intelligence algorithm

study_pop.textblock: The study population is derived from an anonymous database that contains health examination results of the general population.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- fundus photography around 45Â° field which covers optic disc and macula
- complete identification information
Exclusion Criteria:
- insufficient information for diagnosis.
